sun.name: Sun
sun.info: The Sun is the star at the center of our Solar System. It accounts for about 99.86% of the total mass of the Solar System.

planets.name: Mercury
planets.info: Mercury is the smallest planet and closest to the Sun. It has a large iron core and experiences extreme temperature variations.

planets.name: Venus
planets.info: Venus is the hottest planet in our solar system due to its thick atmosphere. It rotates in the opposite direction to most planets.

planets.name: Earth
planets.info: Earth is the only known planet to harbor life. About 71% of its surface is covered by water.

planets.name: Mars
planets.info: Mars is known as the Red Planet due to iron oxide on its surface. It has the largest volcano and canyon in the solar system.

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.info: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system. Its Great Red Spot is a giant storm larger than Earth that has raged for centuries.

planets.name: Saturn
planets.info: Saturn is famous for its spectacular ring system made of ice and rock particles. It's the least dense planet and would float in water.

planets.name: Uranus
planets.info: Uranus rotates on its side, likely due to a collision early in its history. It has a distinctive blue-green color from methane in its atmosphere.

planets.name: Neptune
planets.info: Neptune is the windiest planet with wind speeds up to 2,100 km/h. It was the first planet discovered through mathematical prediction.
